Galle Face Green, a historic urban park along the Indian Ocean in Colombo, Sri Lanka, is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience the city‚Äôs charm. Spanning over 12 acres, this seafront promenade offers a perfect blend of relaxation, history, and vibrant local culture. The wide open space is ideal for a leisurely stroll or for families and friends to gather, fly kites, or simply enjoy the ocean breeze. The sunset view from Galle Face Green is breathtaking, making it a popular spot for both locals and tourists to unwind in the evenings. The sight of the waves crashing against the shore as the sky turns into hues of orange and pink is simply mesmerizing. Food stalls line the promenade, offering a range of Sri Lankan street food, from spicy isso wade (prawn fritters) to refreshing coconuts. It‚Äôs the perfect way to taste authentic flavors while watching life unfold at the bustling seafront. However, it can get quite crowded, especially during weekends, and finding a peaceful spot might be challenging. The cleanliness can vary, but the atmosphere is generally lively and welcoming. In conclusion, Galle Face Green is more than just a park‚Äîit‚Äôs a cultural landmark that captures the essence of Colombo. Whether you‚Äôre there for a quiet walk or to enjoy some street food, it offers a relaxing escape with a dash of local flavor.

As you walk along the Green, the salty breeze carries the sounds of laughter and the rhythmic lapping of waves against the shore. The horizon is a canvas painted with the vibrant hues of sunset, casting a golden glow over the entire area. Families, friends, and couples are seen strolling, flying kites, or simply sitting on the grass, soaking in the picturesque surroundings. The charm of Galle Face Green is not just in its scenic beauty but also in the cultural tapestry it displays. Street vendors line the walkway, offering an array of local delicacies that are as much a feast for the senses as the view. The aroma of freshly fried isso wade (shrimp fritters) mingles with the sweet scent of tropical fruits, inviting you to indulge in the flavors of the island. Children run about with abandon, their joyful shrieks mingling with the sound of the ocean, while couples sit hand-in-hand, whispering sweet nothings as the sky transitions from blue to shades of pink and purple. The beach is a mosaic of life, each group adding its unique color to the vibrant tableau. As night falls, the Green takes on a different persona. The setting sun gives way to a blanket of stars, and the string lights from the nearby street food stalls cast a warm, inviting glow. The sound of music drifts through the air, a gentle melody that complements the rhythmic waves. It's a place where time seems to slow down, allowing you to savor every moment. Galle Face Green is more than just a beach; it's a cultural hub, a place of relaxation, and a window into the soul of Colombo. It's where memories are made, whether it's the joy of tasting a spicy snack for the first time or the peace of watching a magnificent sunset. Each visit leaves an imprint on your heart, a lovely reminder of the beauty of Sri Lanka and the serenity that can be found in the simplest of pleasures.

Galle Face Green is a picturesque and vibrant destination that offers a refreshing escape from the bustling city life in Colombo. The view from Galle Face Green is truly breathtaking, particularly in the morning when the golden rays of sunlight dance upon the gentle waves. The serene ambiance and cool sea breeze create a peaceful atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for a leisurely stroll or a morning jog. The lack of crowds during the early hours further enhances the tranquility, allowing visitors to fully immerse themselves in the natural beauty of the surroundings. As the day progresses, Galle Face Green transforms into a lively hub of activity, with families picnicking, children flying kites, and locals engaging in various recreational activities. However, the charm of the morning hours lies in its peacefulness, making it the perfect time to unwind and rejuvenate in the lap of nature.

A popular picnic spot for families, the Galle Face arena has become well known  for the civil disobedience movement which was the driving force in Sri Lanka's political turmoil in the recent past. The long and narrow area is very well maintained and Sri Lankans , well known for their cleanliness , ensure that the place is kept clean. The place has once again become a calm and quiet place fit for family picnics. Many well known land marks of Colombo city like Presidential Office are located on the other side of the road facing the Indian Ocean. A sandy beach front has been converted into a public arena. Came here to watch the sunset and enjoy the cool evening breeze. The street food there is very good and we had some very good barbecued chicken kottu roti, beef fried rice, and cuttlefish curry. There are benches all along the sea face where you can sit and stare at the water.

A nice stroll in the evening as the weather cools off and chance to watch the sun set over the Indian ocean. It is busy with locals flying kites, eating snacks and enjoying time with family and friends.
Another park. Beautiful location beside the sea. TripAdvisor want a minimum of 100 characters so I'm waffling.

Nice place for a walk and to relax with an ice cream.

Great location for a morning walk or to spend the evening and watch the Sunset. This has been a family location for Long years. Even independence day celebration and May day celebration is held in this location.
Great place to meet the locals and try the local food from kiosks during the evening. Somewhere there is no light but its safe place. Good opportunity to meet the local life and people
Good place to experience the sunset. Would be great of people try to keep place more cleaner. Small food places can be found in the waking area. Love the isso wade they sell.
Beautiful view of the ocean and a nice walk along Galle face. Lots of street food vendors selling delicious sea food and other snacks. Nice chill out spot.

Make sure you come here for the sunset. It feels the whole of Colombo comes here to watch it. You will watch the locals swim (fully clothed) and kick beach balls around
Galle Face Green is a nice ocean-side urban park and walking track. its best suited for morning and evening walks. walking distance from Taj Samudra and has many eatries as well.

We found many people flying kites. Ocean on one side and Colombo's skyline on the other side, evening breeze is just perfect. Food stalls aren't very hygienic. You will find locals enjoying a sort of picnic in the ground.
This is a the main beach front in Colombo. There food vendors and a seafood restaurant. This is always crowded. Ideal place to hang around during evenings or go for a walk or jog in the mornings .

The stalls were setting up for the evening so it was a hive of activity with stall holders bustling around getting ready. The Galle Face green is a huge lawn over looking the Indian Ocean where many locals come with their families and spend the evening flying kites, walking along the sea coast having quick snacks and socializing. As for tourist a few blocks away is the Historical buildings renovated to its original status serving Food n beverage, gift shops and Coffee n Tea Boutiques serving the finest Sri Lankan hot beverages...a must in the evening after enjoying the sunset on the green....
A must visit place in heart of Colombo. A nice place to relax and get a view of commercial developments, skyline of Colombo.

Our hotel was not too far from here. so we took a couple of leisurely walks along the beach to watch the sunset and take in the cooling breezes in the evenings. However we refrained in trying out the street food even though it was very tempting. There were lots of people in the evenings.

Our Hotel was just around the corner from here so we walked along the front on a couple of evenings. Lots of development ongoing, but this doesn‚Äôt put visitors off. Kids were flying kites on the Green, there are many local food vendors on the front and some 5 star Hotels.

We call there is beach but actually people can not swim there. The construction is still kept doing as they are building new Colombo city . If your lucky enough to be in colombo try to visit galleface  green and also dobt forget to visit , iconoc Shangri la , taj samudra, Galadari, hilton colombo , Cinnamongrand , Galleface  hotel , Kingsburry hotel , Galleface one  and man made island of 500acers .

- stretch of promenade filled with locals & tourists - stalls selling street foods/ snacks & junk foods - nice place to chill out, ppl watch & watch sunset on the clear day ** avoid restaurants stalls unless you know your pricings
It is nothing special but you can have a nice stroll along the coast line. Try the food stalls. Food is very nice. Also vendors of all kinds of toys available.
This has quite a long promenade with many street vendors and a large grassy area where many people  were there with families and kites. Great for people watching and watching the sun set.

The Galle Face Green is not the same beautiful place we knew earlier but it is one of the best places to watch the sun set. It is so beautiful  and relaxing with the cool breeze.In fact we were at Galle Face Hotel and walked to Galle Face Green as the crowd reduced  .

This I guess used to be a nice area to go to. To me it was just a small walk in between the sea, construction sites and a bunch of street food vendors. Could be nice for the sunset however that night the weather did not allow to see it properly.

If you ever feel like you want sit in silence by the ocean and watch the sun set while the waves are crashing below your feet, this is the best place for you. A quick get away by the ocean in your way home. However do stay aware of what you eat if you do get hungry.

There is a boundary wall to the sea where you can sit with popcorn in your hand and enjoy the view and cold breeze.

This is one of the popular urban park in the heart of Colombo. It's a 12 acre land area stretches along the beach that gives the magnificent view of the Indian ocean. However, I avoid day time since not a fan of getting burnt and tanned by mid day sun. Early morning and night are the best time to enjoy the cool breeze.  But place is crowded at night time and weekends are the busiest. There are plenty of food stalls to try out some Sri Lankan street foods. No idea how hygiene and have only tried them few times. Kids won't avoid  ice cream carts and toy sellers. Over all must to experience in Colombo.

We went here around 1pm in the afternoon to avoid the crowd we have been warned about.. Turns out to be a wise decision..it was quiet,not many people around.. The water is amazing though.. There are stalls for local snacks n some for chips n drinks as well.

Gallen Face Green is a very nice place just to walk around. Lots of people selling food and beverages. Popular place for people and families having pick nick, flying a kite or just stroll around. Great place to se the sun set. We also celebrated New Years Eve here. A big concert and thousands of people, a memorable evening.
This beach is awesome for walking, especially in evening before sunset, unfortunately we couldn't see the sunset because of the weather, but it's crowd and nice

This square should rather be called ‚ÄûGalle Face Brown‚Äú. The lawn is in a pitiable and there is nothing more than the lawn and some street vendors around. That is sad a this location has some much potential, being directly at the waterfront.

This is a KM long walkway facing the sea. There is very limited area where you can actually get down and enjoy the sand and sea. The area is dotted with street food vendors with everyone selling almost the same menu. Nice to spend some time during sun set.
Really get a walk in it with the beach also have  a prawn vadi too it will make you more happy in the night with many lights and sounds good walk walk will be happy

Lets face it , Colombo is not a pretty city. On that context Galle face seems quite nice. It is good for a short stroll, and the most important sight is actually the hotel. Not much more to see or explore.
It's, good to reach there after 5pm.parking is ample. Good for kids to walk run kites. If you go during day time. An umbrella is a must or a hat.

One of My favouriteplaces in Colombo! Here Lankesian have gathered for a long time, just to stroll along the beach all the way to Galle Face hotel...stayed there some weeks ago ... still a Very nice place to visit, though some spectacular Peninsula (?) is created by China on the northern shore.... Great spot for sunset, especially if you walk all the way to the Galle Face hotel for the flag ceremony at sunset, and then walk along the promenade. Beach is very clean. I like this place for an evening walk along the sea front. A good place to visit, but would not want to eat there. Had a couple of beers there and watched the sunset over the ocean. There were some toilets which were very dirty away from the stalls near the road.

Well this is one kind of an open park built alongside the Indian Ocean in the heart of Colombo ..it is a very nice evening spot to sit back relax and enjoy the ocean along with local food delicacies ..it stretches for about half a kilometre and it‚Äôs a very nice place for an evening walk ...it is a very scenic spot.

Ok for visit with family and friends.but this place change since last 10 years.you cannot feel tje old galle face.lot of new building, expansive street food.

Interesting place to watch people and the sunset. A few street food places but otherwise not much for drinking/dining options. However right next to galle face hotel if you are looking for some place more "refined" to while away some time.
Nothing great about this place . For travellers  who have been to beach destinations earlier can easily avoid this place . One can just go for justevening walk if you have time .

With the Port City coming up right there next to the old parliament and Kingsbury Hotel, we all will miss the Galle Face. The lovely sunrise, mesmerizing flag hosting by army guards, pumps and thumps of military drills and of course the Colombo early morning joggers. All these going to be a miss when you travel next.

Just ok, nice place to have a short evening walk if you‚Äôre in the area or eating dinner in a near by restaurant. Can watch the locals flying kites. Don‚Äôt need to spend much time here, no more than an hour

This is the corner of the sea but you cannot enter into the water as it is deep. The grass is no where to be seen. Only for a small evening walk or to have some local snacks there viewing the sea.

Very busy at night with food stalls and malls and lots of locals there enjoying the evening. Great to walk around and see the sights during the day and evening and get your bearings. Definitely worth a visit. Our hotel was only a minute away so very easy to go out.

Went here 15 years ago and it was bustling with locals enjoying the evening. Returned to find the amount of green much smaller and dustier. I wouldn't bother to walk along her, better to admire the view from the terrace at Galle Face Hotel.

Well, there was nothing green about it when we were here as all the grass is brown; perhaps during the rainy season.  This is essentially a promenade that is popular for locals and tourists to walk just above the coast area.  There are food carts and flea market type stalls.

It's a great place to hang out with friends n family. Situated in a nice location right in the middle of the city still u get to enjoy the beach view n breeze. There r many food stall where u can taste the local food.
Fantastic food and great atmosphere. Loved seeing the children and adults flying their kites and enjoying their evening meal.

Taking a walk along the Green to view the flag lowering ceremony and watch the sunset is a terrific experience. Local families out for the afternoon and evening jostle with tourists, food vendors and other stall holders ina happy mix. Interesting promenade by the sea and a glimpse into the use the area is put to by families and couples out for a walk, a splash, a snack or flying exotic kites. Such a great area for a relaxing stroll! In fact, you may even go around taking in the beautiful sights and the people enjoying themselves. There are street vendors all over the place who are extremely friendly and sell the best and cheapest food! I love it!

What a lovely place to walk of a late afternoon or early evening. Lots of people enjoying the sun, fresh air and sea views. Full of colour, kites, kids, and food - it's a great place to see the locals and experience the Sri Lankan culture.
It was not too crowded and a lovely place too walk in the evening. A few food vendors which i avoided due to lack of hygiene. Rest, its a beautiful walk.
Beach front with wide drive way. Good place to unwind after a day of work. Beauty broken by large construction projects of the port - city.
Nice walk along the foreshore where many Sri Lankan families and teenagers gather.  Probably a nice spot to grab a cheap meal if you are interested.

Galle face green is a famous local hotspot in Colombo, just south of fort, where lots of locals come to meet, socialise, eat and watch the sunset.  We headed up on a poya day and it was pretty busy but not as busy as we expected.  It's certainly a family-friendly place - there are lots of stalls selling toys and there were lots of kids flying kites.  Sadly, as vegetarians, the food stalls were very disappointing - there's lots of them, but they're all pretty much the same, and it was mostly meat and fish.  Still, the atmosphere was good, and it's a good focal point to see the intense development that's happening around this end of Colombo - huge tower block hotels are being built all round, it'll be a very different place in a few years time, so enjoy it while you still can!

We walked from the Old Dutch Hospital to the Galle Face Hotel at 11:30 am on a Sunday.  Armed with bottles of water, sunscreen and wide brimmed hats, we strolled along the "promenade" which on that day was sunny, with barely a breeze.  Vendors were beginning to set up their stands within "smelling distance" of rotting trash. We enjoyed watching kids trying to fly kites, families walking along the rocky, uneven "beach" and parents trying to trying to appease their kids when the ice cream cones they purchased immediately started melting. Granted, this area would have been more interesting in the late afternoon when there is more activity and the temperatures more bearable.  I was disappointed because I  had envisioned a shady tree-lined, grass-covered promenade with a wide sandy beach.
Spectacular place in Asia to relax . Food and transport very cheap.Plenty of Public transport and Tuk Tuk available. Some banks and restaurants are open 24/7.
Its a Good and easy access street food market. No need for dinner that evening. THE kids had alot of rotti and fruits so pleanty for all the family

There is no shade anywhere to sit down and relax. I would have expected some cover. The sea area is littered with glass, bottles, etc. Do not walk barefoot here as it is not safe. Lots of street side vendors selling drinks and food. I went during the day, sure night would be a different experience.
This is a beach front in the city centre .A good place to go for a walk in the morning or evenings. Lots of street food outlets in the late evening.

Galle Face Green is a beach side area full of activities. To me, this is such a cheerful and special place. It‚Äôs perfect to have a romantic picnic with your partner, to have fun with your family or even to hang out with your friends. The area is incredible. Big buildings are rising, on one side os the road. Ocean on the other one. Perfect for a walk

Very interesting developments going on all along beachfront . The best time to visit is in the evening and during the night. In fact, many people walk around Galle Face Green just to see the amazing sunset near the water.It is such a beautiful walk close to the Ocean!

Very unfortunate. Those of us old enough to remember this place would value what we had and no longer!!

After two weeks of kind Sri Lankan people this is the only place that scammed us trough our whole journey. A guy with a smooth talk first talks you in and tells you to choose a nice mix from the showcases and if you want some beers, which are not on the menu. (Normally we ask the price before ordering but after two weeks of unnecessary suspicion we lost our edge a bit). After we finished our meal he presented us an insane bill of over 10.000 rs ($50) including Lion beers for 1100 rs ($6) each and a chicken leg for 1500 rs ($7,50). Locals love this spot and it's perfect for a stroll at sunset. The street food is amazing. Ask for a beer, although it won't be on the menu!!

We were recommended to watch the sunset at Galle Face hotel with a g&t and it was a great tip. We had a drink at the poolside bar overlooking the sea and watched the waves crash as an electrical storm brewed.
Good place for street foods at colombo city area in seasonal greetings.little bit crowded but nice sea waves and als9 sea windy.
A lovely place for an evening walk. Hotels in this vicinity have amazing views too. It gets busy in the evenings and the traffic is hectic pretty much all day but the place is lively and pretty.
One place that should be great, it‚Äôs completely broken. CMC just doesn‚Äôt care about. Ashame for Colombo and Sri Lanka.
Nice place for sunset. Central location, lots of local families gathering. Some small restaurants open for dinner.

A sparse area of grass overlooking the sea, populated with some street food vendors, selling some magnificent fair. However, we nearly fell vicitm to a rouge tuk tuk driver and his tout. We left the front of our hotel and walked towards Fort, and a chap started talking to us. He said do you remember me from Shangri-la, I saw you this morning. I didn't, however with the curse of English incesent politeness, my wife said she did (later admitted she did not) . He offered to show us the way to the local temple, only to state shortly in to the trip that we should take a tuk tuk as there may be some protest today. He summoned a tuk tuk and off we went, leaving him waving us off. Having travelled extensively, experience told me to obtain a price for this first, only to be told that the price was on the meter - suspiciously there was no meter present. In fairness the tour was very good, the temple beautiful and the driver gave us some good information. We were taken back to the hotel, however then came the fun part. The driver stopped us equidistant and therefore as far as was reasonably possible from the hotel entrance and promptly demanded 6500lkr for what was a 10 minute each way journey. He was firmly rebuffed however was persistent in return. We then trudged away from him having refused to hand any cash over at all. Arriving at the Shangri La security Post we spoke with the guard, whose eyes bulged at the demanded price. As soon as the captain of the tuk tuk saw we were in conversation with the guard, the price miraculously changed from 6500 to 650. Weird as I had confirmed the demand of 6500 with captain tuk tuk three times on my phones calculator. Little sod. Needless to say, beware of these shiesters and stand your ground!!

There is a huge land reclamation going on with construction cranes everywhere. The area is windy but not well maintained. Good place to enjoy the evening breeze and setting sun. Food stalls at the location does not look appetising

This is the place of choice for large gatherings and political meetings. On other days, it is full of people, families who want to enjoy their evenings. There are famous fast food shops known as Naana shops, that offer lots of fast food. Have been here many times. This time visited alone, just for a walk in morning. There are more to enjoy on the beach other than that!

When we arrived in Colombo we managed to time it almost perfectly to coincide with what ended up being the largest political rally ever staged in Sri Lanka. The entire green was packed with men and women celebrating/protesting the constitutional crisis of recent weeks. It was some event and we were close witnesses. The next day when we walked the entire length it had returned to normal: children dipping into the Indian Ocean, stalls of street food, kites flying and couples courting. A place to see Colombo relaxing...

This place continues to hold its charm over so many years as far as I can remember.... You can expect a whole array of people from ones just relaxing, people jogging and exercising, kids playing around and numerous street vendors..... However, I wonder how long the place would hold its charm in the future when the Port City comes into operation as it would take away the view and possible sea erosion due to change of wave patterns..... But that's something to worry in the future and you should make a visit to this charming place, but be aware of the ants roaming the entire area, if you are with little kids..... Also it would be better to avoid visiting this place during daytime as the scorching sun would take away all the fun....

This has been a Colombo icon for 60 years that I know of. You can get a good kite for about $4 AU there are 100‚Äôs to choose from , enough room to fly a kite and then go the Galle Face Hotel for afternoon tea,  nice cool breeze on a hot day as well.
close to most of the five star hotels. Everyone goes here to enjoy the Sunset- and you will find it very crowded in the afternoons

Enjoy the sunset and sea breeze with hundreds of locals. Big open spaces, so not crowded, at least by Colombo standards. Have a drink at Barracuda. 250 to 400rps. Eat dinner at one of the stalls eg Nana Raus along esplanade. 400 to 500 rps. Buy and fly a kite for 100 to 200 rps.
a good beach for a chill out with alot of hotels and restaurants around The beach had alot of local sea food outlets which i didn't try tbh The place is worth a visit for sure

This area is great for an evening stroll to take in the sights of local families relaxing and having evening picnics. The street vendors selling food is great to watch and try. We were advised afterwards not to have food there.... but I thought the food was excellent, cheap, and the vendors were very friendly. Particular favourite was the egg and cheese kotthu!!
Good sunset views. Relax at the park. Play some football. Swim in the ocean. Eat the many assortment of food stands. Good way to spend Sunday in Colombo

It is crowded and no more green. Most of the Galle Face Green has been taken over for car parking. It is no more green after the successive gaovernments decided to use it for political rallies There are food stalls but do not look very clean. In my opinion there is nothing special about it now unlike some years back. May be in the late sixties or early seventies.

It is sea front of Colombo, where mostly the locals visit during the sun set and to spend time in the evenings. There many stalls selling food items. Nothing much to see here from the tourist point of view. The coastal road passes along the seashore and many star hotels are located across the road. Gall Face Hotel, which is an iconic landmark of Colombo is located along the sea shore.

A nicely maintained urban park just next to sea. You will notice skyline of Colombo here. The park would a 1Km long and have lot of eateries. We have visited during the morning and as well as evening. I will suggested evening for nice Sunset shot...
Nice to do a daily work on the gallface green .nice to see the sea and enjoy the sea brease to start the day.

Stay safe from some dodgy locals try to drag you into stuff. However many locals go there to relax with kids. Some street shops ok to try. Not so amazing view but relaxing and you can see historical Gall Face Hotel.

The green was very busy when we arrived, and the stalls were just setting up. Our first full day in Sri Lanka, and a great place to sit for a while, watch the locals enjoy the sea, watch the sun go down, and eat great street food. We weren't keen on Colombo at all, but this made up for it!
Good to go for a walk, but still needs cleaned up. Smells in places and their are loads of beggars. Loads of police about though which is good.

Galle Face green is a promenade (like we have marine drive / Bandra reclamation in Mumbai) where one can have a leisurely walk, spend peaceful time by the ocean & also indulge in some snacks. All the 5* hotel chains like Taj Samudra, Hilton, Shangri-La, ITC (under construction) are at Galle face road overlooking the ocean.

One of the best ways to indulge in a  truly Sri Lankan experience. A leisurely walk, spicy food and the best place to see how locals enjoy an outing with their families and friends.  Definitely not to be missed if in Colombo!

It's a really nice place to go and relax your mind. and also a great place for couples and families. It's one of my favourite place. This place has very tasty street foods. one of popular shop called 'NANA'S Cafe'

Such a happy place, aside from the huge port the Chinese are building adjacent to the green. Lovely to see the locals promenading and playing cricket a the sun sets over the Indian Ocean. The Isso Vadai, orange pancakes with prawns are delicious, a culinary highlight.

This is one of my favourite place to roam around with my hub and kid. Specially i run to grab my favourite stuff that's "ISSO WADE" (MADE OUT OF PRAWNS) It's very yummy any kind of junk food can be grab over here

We walked from the Galle Face Hotel to the large roundabout by the historic town. Whichever way we looked we seemed to be looking at a giant building site. Once all the construction work is finished it might be more pleasant! The sea is not suitable for bathing.

on weekends its packed with locals and tourists... can get a bit crowded.. not all that green anymore... the street food outlets are so many.... one must try the Prawn cookie (local name isso wade) its delicious and spicy!... Kite flying is a common sight at gall face green... saw youngsters bringing their musical instruments and singing away... real part atmosphere

Its a nice place tospend the evening in Colombo with lots pf people around and cool breeze from sea embraces you. There are small hawkers selling sea foods down the lane which is pretty inexpensive. After drinks at the Kingsbury's rooftop bar, we were heading for the Galle Face Hotel for another drink. Our host asked if we wanted to take a tuk tuk or walk. No brainer! Of course we wanted to walk and we didn't even know that would mean a stroll down Galle Face Green. What a great bustling place it is. I'm reminded of Mumbai's Marine Drive or Zanzibar's Stone Town sea-front food market. Dozens of small stalls selling the kind of food that looks great, probably tastes great, but is a bit of a risk when you're new in town and don't want to risk food poisoning from a Crab Cake that's been sitting in the sun all afternoon. We walked on a blustery afternoon, enjoying the crowds, watching families at play, couples a-courting, and Colombo's locals having fun to one side and the ocean crashing in on the other. Loved it!

It is a stretch of about 500 meters along the sea on one side and star class hotels surrounding the area, northern end is Kingsbury Hotel and southern end is famous Galle face hotel with colonial architecture. Friday to Sunday is busy and crowded with locals visiting this place. So Monday to Thursday is highly recommended for a peaceful visit. There are about 200m of stalls selling food and drink of various types so no one need go hungry. Also it is a great place for flying kites and a great number were in evidence. Watching the Sunset is great. So if interested visit around 5-7p.m. After 8 p.m. it is not recommended for a tourist to hang around although tourist police is present.

The view of the sea is good as the ramp takes you into the ocean. But on a Sunday or Holiday the beach is very crowded. If you like adventure you can go down to the rocks, but the sea is very rough out there. There are several stalls selling various food, the most popular are the Prawn Cakes and the Crab Cakes. Nice place to spend some leisure time watching the sea.

Hi Imagine a sunset, then consider this! I‚Äôd walked over 4km‚Äôs from the movenpick to get here and the exercise was well worth the effort I like the Galle Face and the green Today, kits were flying kites Yesterday, some were playing football If I lived here, I‚Äôd be beating a path here everyday! Well done to the Colombo municipal teams for keeping this place so clean and safe
gall face green is very popular place among Sri Lankan ,any age group can relax, enjoy this ground with  see breeze ,nice view ,food outlet, venders, you can enjoy more.very popular among kite.

I stayed in Colombo for nearly a month and galle face green was just across the road from my hotel, so it was a big part of my stay. The ocean side is nice and well maintained site and offers the best wind and relaxing spot in Colombo. There are also street food available there along with a festive atmosphere in the night time.
It‚Äôs Colombo‚Äôs best location with high rise hotels overlooking the sea. Gardens with a long walking path it‚Äôs a good family hangout.
We were there in the evening and view was so iconic. Loved every moment there and highly recommend for everyone who visit Colombo.
A good place for spending time with friends. There are some famous hotels there. You will find mobile food shops there.

column7: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
column11: It's a big area that overlooks the sea. It has alot of food vendors, toy sellers, ice cream trucks and tons of kites flying around. Try to avoid during public holidays and weekends. As it gets too crowded. You can fly a kite, kids can run around,pony rides. The food sold there is absolutely delicious. It's walking distance from a few five star hotels like Hilton , Kingsbury, Taj Samudra,Galadari, Sheraton, Ramada and Galle Face hotel. And, it's best to visit when it's closer to sunset (as earlier during the day it's quite hot). Enjoy!

Great place to see a bit of really Sri Lankan life. I walked down here 30 years ago on my honeymoon, it has changed dramatically since then. You still see young people playing cricket and others just going for a walk . If you want to walk down the water front this is the place to be.
This place is nothing special. It‚Äôs really a place for male locals only. It‚Äôs kind of gross to be honest
My son did not feel comfortable walking here.  It spoils it when random men co.e up to you and chat and they only want to sell you trips.  It makes people not want to look around.  A disappointment.

We stayed at Galle Face hotel and the Galle Face green was just next to it. Used to be all grassy green but sadly hardly any grass left. There was a lot of construction around and the ambience wasn't as pleasing as we saw a lot of rubbish strewn. There were street stalls and on the weekend families came to play with the kites and had a walk. I think it would have been a lot better if it was maintained and kept clean..

Went there at night and morning. has many people and tourists there. Many street food and people selling things around. Try to reduce the contact with people as the double the prices there. you may try some local food if you want. Get ready it is not very clean in general

They called it Galle face Green... Now u can't see the grass. crowded with locals specially on weekends (Fri/Sat & sun). Good for morning jogging, walking & for running. U get fresh Air. Beach is not that good for swimming and its not very clean. Sea is very rough most of the time may be because of port city project. plenty of good hotels are close by... Galle Face Hotel, Taj Samudra, Ramada Colombo, Shangrila, Kingsbury and Galadari to name few.. plenty of great local cheap and spicy eateries to test - may be over priced but still cheap for Foreigners. Toilet facilities are available but not that clean and payable around Rs.10. You can buy a kite and fly if you have nothing else to do - You will enjoy for sure. People are always smiling and helpful - its a safe place even at night but dark. There will be more new hotels coming up around Galle Face...

If you are travelling to colombo you won't miss this place. Though legendary galle face green is not same as it was 10 years ago still it has it's own beauty with it. But it's not green anymore. With Port city is taking over the most parts of the beach still there is little bit of beach left to enjoy with your family. You can enjoy a evening walk with having sri lankan street food. But check the prices before you order something as they might over charge you. there are so many places nearby to have a beer and chill in the evening.

Galle Face Green is the best place to enjoy you evening in Colombo. You can fly kites, eat street food and watch sunset. The huge open ground is filled with people every evening. A must visit place in Colombo city
It's called pearl of Colombo .Everyday the place was covered with lots of people. Every morning I used to go for walk.

This is refreshing place amidst the busy city of Colombo. We visited this place around afternoon. I would suggest best time to visit Galle face green is morning or evening. This place gives positive vibes of city of Colombo. It has Beautiful view of Taj Samudra hotel right opposite it. Lovely place to sit and chit chat or just stare the ocean. Some times it can be a crowded place so quite seekers may be little disappointed.

On my way to an evening of socializing I spent yday a little bit of quality time enjoying the beauty and wonder of nature yday. The Galle face green was kept clean and there were plenty of street stalls and hawkers selling tasty street food. Being a working day there were less crowds and traffic. I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of sourroundings, however the sea was too rough to go down to soak my feet in water. All in all, it was a brief interlude to a busy day and I would recommend to anyone to come and relax and enjoy the amazing sun set at the Galle face any day!
Great large open area. Food stalls and community all gathering at night to see sunset. Fly kites or eat local food.

Game face green has a long history. At one time it had been cricket grounds for Colombo. Now it is a place where people come for a relaxing time. It usually is to crowded for my liking but the v green is inviting despite all the crowds. If you are brave enough you could taste pineapple or kottu roti from one of the vendors at the seaside. Take a stroll along the beach. The sea is inviting but not safe other than for wading.
Interesting part of the culture, it is a popular place with locals and visitors alike. It has a great history.
Galle face Green is a leisure place at  hart of Colombo city in Sri Lanka, you can walk with sea breeze and can enjoy having some street food as well, more crowned in weekends.

Don‚Äôt take pictures or pay to interact with monkeys. Saw a guy where you turn at the south end of the path mistreating the monkey - so much that the monkey was making loud noises :( Sadly no one who was around seemed to care. If you want to see monkeys there are plenty when you go to Ella and Anuradhapura and at the train stations in those locations. They‚Äôre so much cuter that way and you‚Äôll often see moms carrying their baby monkeys.

It was windy. So the kites were out in force which is delightful. Watch out for the hawkers and those who simply want to pinch your money. Otherwise worth the walk to take in the Sri Lankan‚Äôs relaxing.

I was in Colombo earlier in the year in January. I was visiting Colombo with my friends. I was staying at the hotel right next to the Galle Face Green, and it was so beautiful. The greens are right by the sea, and it was beautiful sight to see in the morning. The best thing was to go here in the morning and feel the cool sea breeze in the morning. But it got really crowded through the day. Beating sun doesn't stop anyone! The Galle Face Greens are beautiful, but very crowded, so make sure you know what you're in for.
The place in manly a large ground and beach view along the way of road side . mostly crowded in the evening and good to visit during morning.
Great little food stalls, snake charmer, school children playing, kites flying and lots of locals enjoying this area. A really great atmosphere.

I had been advised that it was perfectly safe to walk alone in the middle of the day along the front here, & it was BUT I could have done without being approached several times by young local men trying to engage in conversation, suggesting I go with them (I am seriously middle aged!).  This was despite my brisk & purposeful striding (necessary in some places to speed past the urine smells).  Whilst it's lovely to hear & see the waves crashing & experience the buzz around the street stalls, the unwelcome attention sadly soured my ambulations

Going here around sunset is just bliss. All the local families come here to fly kites and let their children play. Lots of street food vendors (although they all sell the exact same things...). The whole atmosphere really feels nice. We can recommend everyone to go here to get away from all the big constructions in the rest of the city.

Not very exciting grass is bear and dusty but worth heading over to the viewing platform dusk for a sunset worth the wait Walking along the waters edge is not too bad looking st the vendors the halal vendor nearest the galle hotel looked the busiest and smelt good

Highly recommend to take a walk down there around 5pm for some snacks. Lots of street food vendors Also some naf toys for children. Wasn't stuck on the snake man or the chap with the monkey in trousers.

Galleface green is one of the most attractive beach front place in Colombo.. Surrounded by class hotels and restaurants.. We had a great time.. It was a Saturday evening and full of people.. More entertaining for kids.. Kids loves to send kites.. Road side food was yummy.

I was staying at a hotel close to the Galle face, so I thought if going for a sea side walk at late evening. It's a secluded place on weekdays so not advisable to visit alone. On weekends or early  evening on weekdays however, it's a nice place to visit

I have stayed three times at the Galle Face Hotel next to the Green, which sadly isn't green at all these days.  Yes, you can walk safely there, although I would not recommend it very late at night when there are few people.  It is nice to take a stroll there next to the water to watch the families and kite flying.  It has been 7 years since my first visit and I have to express my disappointment at how dirty it has become.  Garbage strewn around everywhere.  If you are staying close by then do take a stroll there, but don't make a special effort.  There is a huge amount of development going on in the area.

A lovely place for a long walk by the beach, the view of the port and buildings around are quite good. The sound of the sea and watching the waves hit the shore is very soothing. we were there for quite a long time and with a bunch of friends it is even more fun.

One of the best place to chill out whether with friends or family or solo. You can sit and enjoy the sea shore plus watch the beauty of colombo city and the tall buildings and the growing infrastructure from this place. This place can be easily reached from any part ane point of colombo city. You can have evening snacks sea food cold drinks here in galle face green.

Nice place for a relaxing stroll. Good for people watching. Lot of interesting street food around. Can see the port city being built. Also can catch the waves if you go to the beach. Galle face hotel is at one end. Good place for afternoon tea.
This place of one of the peaceful in front old Parliament. A few benches where lovebirds use to sit behind the umbrella. Now this place is ruined and commercialised

By the time we reached to place it was almost dark. I think it is good to reach bit early in evening to see the sunset. You will find plenty of Kites flying around and many stalls which are selling seafood snacks. Nice place to spent 1-2 hours with family/friends.
It's a good place to release our stress and some good foods stalls are there... We ate those manioc sticks... I really love them... The view of Colombo from there is superb...

It is a fine idea to leave a big area without any constructions in the heart of busy capital Many come here to relax and spend their leisure. You can spend hours looking at the sea speechless Kids run and play Some fly kites. Parking is available. Reputed hotels are close and they offer services. I think evening is the best. On some days certain events like meetings rally's competitions are organized. They don't disturb you. I like to keep on my eyes far beyond at the horizon in the dusk. Its amazing

Galle Face Green is my Moms and Fathers favorite place because of their old memories.  This is a really beautiful place with the sea and can see lots of kits in the sky all the time and also this has a nice view of the almost all the popular hotels such as Galle Face,Taj Samudra,Kingsburry,Ramada,Galadari and Shangri-La hotels. Actually this is the best place to watch the sun set inside colombo.Nothing but the best try isso wade if you could make it to galle face green because thats something very special there.

In the middle of a congested city this is a lovely open space for people to relax, walk and meet friends. Lots of outdoor eating places. Have to to sit on the lawn unless you take a folding chair or rug. There is no entrance fee. Children come to fly kites or play ball. Adults can walk or sit and relax.

The green is still a popular place to spend an evening. Usually it is very crowded. A lot of food places around. The scenic beauty has been spoiled by the land reclamation from the sea to build the port city.
Without this ground and the sea..., in the heart of the City, will be dull and boring. No one is missed if visiting Colombo for fun and enjoyment

This is an aerial remarkable with stretches of small stalls selling food. The food is freshly prepared directly in front of you. I particularly superb stall is NANA, serving a fresh portion of crab, prawns, beef, lamb and chicken served with rice or porata bread or even a wrap. The sea front also consist of various other stalls of which sell kites and nighttime illuminating toys. The beachfront it self is perfect for flying kites and time passes very quickly in doing so.

If you are by yourself and want to watch a sunset over the vast ocean, visit Galle Face Green and hang around. There are a lot of nice guys ready to say,‚ÄùHello,‚Äù and join you for a coffee, our just walk with you along the sea face and talk about life!
nice place to admire the ocean with pineapple , prawn vadai and i cream. also a small wash with sea water. very rush always

Galle Green isn't green, and the view is of the tower blocks under construction and the container port. But in fact it's lovely at sunset with lots of families enjoying themselves and kids flying kites. You can have a snack, a beer, or a whole dinner at the many stalls cooking various goodies. And you can buy a kite, or any number of coloured lights. Highly recommended and free as well.
crowded with health conscious people and relaxing ones from morning to evening. with ample opportunities to try various dishes
Was here for my fifth anniversary. Great place for all kind of tourists. One can have a nice evening walk here.

This large park area is used by the locals for flying kites, playing general sports and as it is also on the ocean, swimming. A grest place to watch the locals and the art of kite flying. There are several street food vendors on the site all day and this ramps up in the evening. Worth the visit. There is a restaurant at one end opposite the Galle Face Hotel but they dont serve alcohol.

Nothing exciting really , but just nice to sit on the chairs and watch people. I sat down on one of the seats and just relaxed with an ice cream, watched the locals, lots of kites flying around and watched the sea.

The green area needs improvement but the green is sufficient for anyone who wants to lay a mat and lie down and enjoy the sea breeze. There are decent eating places as well as no so great places to eat.
This the beach on marine drive of Sri Lanka and they have named it as well Maine drive. Beautiful, serene and must body place.
The most busiest beach in the city, specially during week ends evening. Ideal place for flying kites for kids. Ample of parking available. A very good location to see the beauty of Colombo city...
We enjoyed the evening stroll and watched the sun set beautiful. Nice place to hang out. Just take a seat and enjoy the place. And don‚Äôt miss to eat ‚ÄúWade‚Äù.
Beautiful sea road ending with a nice beach .. sounds similar to Indian.... They even call the road Marine drive only.. overall worth visiting.

Go in early evening, that's when the atmosphere picks up and more food options are available. Even flying a kite works in the dark, (there are enough lights). Had a great time, everyone was friendly, breeze glorious.
Well worth a visit. The best place we found in Colombo for cheap street food. A lot of kite flying going on.
If you want to see 'real' sri lankans unwind, spend an hour here in the evening watching the kits with them.  Is it spectacular, no.  It is an honest slice of life, yes.

This is an area where visitors and couples gather to watch the sunset. Due to its popularity it's bare earth, rather than grass. There are food stalls in the evening and a carnival atmosphere. Land reclamation works are in progress at the northern end so the precinct may soon look quite different. An interesting spot for people watching with a lovely sunset to cap it off.

Even though its name starting with Galle, Galle face green located in heart of colombo. Lovely park with jogging track. Wonderful place for hangout. We used to visit here beacuse of "isso wade". many food options available. Foods are cheap and yummy. As far as i know this place was initially used for horse racing and as a golf course. Many five stars hotels like surrounded by this place.

Much talked about as a must see but it is really lacking in care and attention. Galle Face Green is just a big open space overlooking the beack and overlooked by the famous Galle Face Green Hotel. It is very crowded by Sri Lankans and Tourists alike. Lots of kite flying by the locals and lots of street food vendors. Sadly the Green appears to receive no attention to landscaping or cleanliness... with rubbish everywhere. Beach is rocky and also unclean..... such a shame. We chose to have a look, take a little walk but did not stay to eat. I try to imagine how lovely it would be if it was looked after.
This just a great place to chill out. The locals fly kites while tourists have a few drinks at the bar. There's also plenty of street food to try too

I've been to the Galle Face Green a couple of times. First time I visited the green was in 2004! The spot changed a lot since I last remember it. It's definitely more crowded now. I was staying at one of the hotels close by...I asked the hotel staff if they ever eat from the many food stalls on the green...Apparently not, was told that they can't trust the hygiene or the quality of the food! Took my little nephew there to fly a kite though and we had fun doing that.
If in Colombo you should find time to visit, it's just vibrant with lots of kids flying kites and people enjoying themselves.We purchased street food which was tasty and at a reasonable price.

We went this evening after a LONG day of travelling in from England. Saw a street food stall that was very busy with locals - we had a look and the staff were very friendly and explained the menu well. They offered us tastes of the food and I tried to order. He was offering us so much food and we asked for rice, calamari, a sausage and a cheese naan. He then offered us some noodle thing and I said ‚Äúcan we have half noodle half rice‚Äù. He said yes. We stupidly didn‚Äôt ask the price. He then brought us 2 x rice dishes, 1 x noodle, 2 x sausages, 1 x calamari and 2 x beers. We presumed they were being very friendly  and this was just the portion sizes. Despite being more food then we could ever eat we laughed it off and said ‚Äúoh well it‚Äôs street food - how much can it really cost‚Äù... 8,900 rupees which is ¬£40!!!! He brought the menu over and talked through it exactly and added it up in front of us. I said no that is too expensive - you‚Äôve shown us the wrong prices. But the owners wouldn‚Äôt budge and we left feeling ripped off for mediocre food. Other than that the beach is a state - the only nice thing is that there are lots of kites being flown which is pretty - we would of bought one and had a go but we were too wounded by the over pricing.

In the night This Place is Crowded but Beautiful. I am going Gall Face every Single Night To Enjoy The View and think .Sitting on a bench and enjoying the view of sea is the Best thing of my Busy day . There are many Food shops and you can have anything you want . see you again Tonight
We went one of the evenings for the sunset. It was very nice with the waves breaking, people strolling along and the sunset was gorgeous.

Place where locals gather to chill out and fly kites, visually pleasing. Gets busier as day goes on, very busy by evening time, kites flying even in the dark! Local food fare huts around. Very popular place.
The fact that this place is so talked about says more about what a crap place Colombo is than anything else.  It is dirty tawdry and depressing here.

Perfect place to watch the sunset Drop by in the evening to watch the golden sunset you'll never forget. Pretty crowded on holidays and weekends. There are many food stalls available although the quality and hygiene of which I cannot vouch for

A huge open space near by Galle Face hotel, heavily crowded on week ends, people spent lot times for flying kites, Most of stone slabs crowded with romantic couples and drunkards, A polished road on beach side giving people a nice sea side walk with lots of shacks serving local sea food dishes. Beach not present as its rocky and dangerous.. Dont go after 9 pm as its a no man's land.

This will always be Colombo's National pride, but with the new Chinese Port City being built the beauty of the once sea coastal view plus the wonderful breeze there was blowing across the green is no more, Still an active venue for families to gather and also for the fitness tycoons to do their normal exercise routines. Sad to see this once beach view skyline vanish.
This was an awesome place for a family outing when we were kids. We could even get to the beach. Now it's crowded with unauthorised sellers, beggars and drunkards. Not a good place to visit.

Our driver was quite proud of the Green, although he realises that the patchy grass and developing new port city nearby, detracts from the ambience. Have a look, imagine a crowd, and move on. Maybe we were there at the wrong time.

Drop by in the evening to watch the golden sunset you'll never forget. Pretty crowded on holidays and weekends. There are many food stalls available although the quality and hygiene of which I cannot vouch for.

Galle Face Green is a favorite place for Sri Lankans and tourists to take a casual walk along the shore of the Indian Ocean in the evening.  There is much to see.  There are street food sellers, children paying with kites, and some places to put your feet in the water.  The area is easily reached by tuk tuk. Galle Face Green is the flanked by some of the most famous colonial buildings in Sri Lanka, good restaurants, and the old parliament buildings.  Personally, the best thing for me are the wonderfully refreshing sea-breezes that blow new life into one after a hot day in the sun. Most definitely a family place, nice open spaces for runners and exercise freaks and totally safe.  Go there to meet Sri Lankans and experience the inner child in you by flying a kite,

It is a place where people come in the evening for walk and kite flying. A favourite amongst locals for a stroll along the beach side. some construction work is going around may be some land reclamation and newer hotels coming up nearby.
We stayed at the Galle Face Hotel and a wander on the Green is a must do if you stay at the hotel -  view was pretty,  kite flying was fun and the hawkers weren‚Äôt aggressive

spent a lot of time at this beautiful place on the beach. hive of activity at night watching sun set with delicious quick meals on offer to locals and visitors. My wife and I spent many evenings enjoying the vibe, the sound of the sea, watching the construction work and children enjoying themselves while having sundowners. awesome experience in the heart of the bustling city with beautiful hotels on the main street.

Take an hour out of your calendar and take a stroll down Galle Face Green and then back again. This is where you meet the real Sri Lanka. You see a united Sri Lanka with al kinds of families having a get together on a blanket, young couples out for a walk, many kids and adults trying their luck with keeping their kite high up in the air, school kids out on a fieldtrip, munks enjoying the sun set, sales people preparing dinner etc. On a walk like this it is hard to imagine that not long ago there was a war here. Everything looks so peace fully and no one seem to care about all the different religions gathered together on this nice spot - they all have one thing in common - to have a nice time :-) We absolutely loved this visit.

Galle Face Green is an amazing retreat while visiting Colombo! It offers food and entertainment even a pastime of flying kites, even at night! It was very enjoyable to relax and wonder this relaxing spot. With a family friendly environment and the scenic view of the ocean it made this place very enjoyable.
This is one of the best areas in the heat of Colombo. It‚Äôs has a lot of hotels and restaurants and major business hub of the city. Clean and nice.

Would definitely recommend a walk along this coast line. We happened to be there on a Friday and Saturday evening and it was beautiful to the open space filled with kids flying kites. In addition to the hundreds of kites and the kids laughter, you can sample some street food from the many street vendors. For me, this was the nicest activity to do in Colombo.

Decent place... Not much veg food though. Lot of sea food stalls were there. Lot of open spaces, so kids will enjoy. Enjoy the pineapple there. It will be very sunny but it's not like a beach where you can wear beachwear. It's a family picnic spot.
A place where locals and tourists are seen happy üòÉ bring your own food or enjoy the food court of local delicacies.  Sit at the edge and look at the horizon of Indian Ocean

It's always nice to be at beach and when you see lot of people enjoying and happy around you is even more nice feelings you get, this beach has a small over bridge where you can stand over the waves, stairs to watch from far, bay to wet your feet, street food to fill stomach, kites to fly in breezy wind, what more you want? A smile on your face, it's free here. Must visi
One of the nicest views of the Indian Ocean from the hotel coffee shops and the staff are very friendly and helpful too

Still a nice place for a decent walk and a nice sea view but I was sad to see now after my last visit no one seems to be taking care of the rubbish, plastic and paper blowing around and many locals to lazy to place rubbish in bins just sticking discarded bags whatever is close by. This area needs urgent management as it will only get busier with all the new development and is a prime location.

Galle Face Green is perfect spot to smash some selfies, but since the day shops came there, its now a horrible place! "Nana" hotel in there is extremely populated and saw them exploit the peace of the place. Good sea view...........

Maybe it was the time of year, but Galle Face Green has very little going on, and wasn't very green!  The grass was scorched and there were only a few vendors. You cannot swim there, so you can only view the sea and all the construction going on....
Extremely polluted and crowds with not much civic sense. Avoid the food sold by vendors if not accustomed to street food
Most of the grass/green is just sand but it was a lovely place to see the local food stalls and the people flying kites
We went for a triathlon so I ended up going many times in two days and would say that it adds charm to the city. Most of Colombo seems to be there, walking and running.

This is no longer the Galle Face Green... The place has lost it's old charm. Used to be a beautiful stretch for people to walk, hangout and spend time. Unfortunately, it is no longer so. It is still pretty crowded and from time to time have kite shows along with carts of street food. Interesting to visit but not a must do on any itinerary.
The Gallo Face Green is an urban space made interesting by the people rather than any other unique feature.

We visited late afternoon.  The breeze off the ocean was very welcome.  We bought a kite from stall holders.  They were not at all pushy and very much added to the atmosphere.  School kids came down by the dozens shortly after our arrival and joined in with the kite flying. We spent about an hour just enjoying the waves crashing, the refreshing breeze, kites and the relaxed atmosphere.
This was not particularly clean place to visit so be warned. In general its more of a place to understand sri lankan urban culture and their lives.

Located in the heart of the business capital of of the country; Colombo, the Galle Face Green in Sri Lanka is a five hectare ocean-side urban park, which stretches for a half kilometre along the coast. It is a magnificent place to witness a marvelous sun set over western coast of Sri lanka. The Galle Face Green in Sri Lanka was initially used for many recreational activities. These include activities such as horse racing and golf. It was also used as an area to play cricket, polo, football tennis and rugby. mostly children's use this place for fly a kites. & you can taste various kind of street foods here.

My friend and I went to one of the street food stalls for dinner. We ate 2 noodle dishes, a beef dish and 2 beers. Very simple street food. When it came time to pay, our bill came to 6200 rs. Shocked, we tried to reason with the owners. They would not take no for an answer. We were not carrying that amount of money, and they held one of us hostage while the other had to tuktuk back to our accommodation. We scrounged together a mix of AUD and rupee and they finally let us leave DO NOT TRUST FOOD VENDORS HERE

We visited the place as it was recommended through a friend. There isn‚Äôt much to do at the green, lots of food venders trying to sell you things. We weren‚Äôt that impressed and googled where there was to eat near by and found a Pizza Hut.

Galle Face Green is a space near the sea in Colombo Sri Lanka. It is a dust free environment during the day time. The wind comes from sea and goes through this land. Therefore a better place to sit and rest. But you may be uncomfortable because of the heavy Sun light The wind comes from land side brings dust & goes through this land during the night.

When we are in Colombo we went to many places that feels good. So we decided to go the famous Colombo beach park Called Galle face green. In there u can find many street food shops mostly they got sea fish and some are delicious. It‚Äôs a nice place to watch a sunset sitting behind the beach watching for flying kites. Nice place
A must visit walk especially in morning and evening. Cool sea breeze along with eateries offer a unique experience

The Green is used as a promenade for a stroll along the edge of a long sea wall. It has a lawn area for sitting ,eating relaxing.At night it is full of family,couples and friends enjoying one and others company. Both  it and the promenade have views to the sea.At.sunset small food stalls are set up along it to buy snacks. Some very tasty. A viewing platform/pier gives you a chance to watch the sun set..The taking down of the national flag at sunset at the monument on the green  is a proud and ritualistic event to be seen. At the right end of the Green there is a  development of  reclaimed sea for land,This project  is by the Chinese Gov with a 99year lease.It will house multi story appt/buildings shopping complexes and is HUGE. It has already destroyed the once clear view of the sunset from the promenade /deck.Cranes and other machinery abound then to be following by multi story buildings. A stroll in the night air,see locals at leisure, and glimpses of the sunset ...your choice.
We enjoyed the evening stroll and watched the sun set beautiful. Small boutique shops selling local evening bites.

Our guide took us to see Galle Face Green and we knew it appears on the list of Top 10 Things to see in Colombo. But honestly, it is just a large piece of lawn on which families and people gather and relax. The surrounding buildings are more interesting than the Green itself.

Nice place to hang out. There are plenty of shops selling street food and its very famous for Isso wade (Prawn topped patty). Very crowded during the weekend because families come with their kids. Would recommend to go there on weekdays by 5 so you can have a clear view of the sunset.

Access : Galle face if located at the  commercial center of Colombo , the capital city of Sri Lanka. It is a Large Green area resided next to the Sea. It is  within 1.5Km from Colombo main Bus Stand / railway station (Pettah ) and just next to many famous star hotels including Shangri la ,  Ramada , Taj Samudra , Galadhari , The Kingsbury , Hilton and Ancient Galle Face Hotel too. There is no entry fee to this location and ample parking available nearby. From Pettah a tuk-tuk will charge you Rs.150 - 200 to drop at Galle Face. Location : The sea at Galle face is calm nice beach area , next to colombo harbour .You will find that many people, children play at the beach and having bath and enjoy. This place is very beautiful during evenings and you will experience amazing sunsets here ( Please see the photos I shared )This green is very famous for Kiting  and everyday you can see kids and elders enjoy kiting . There are many food stalls along the cost and you will find spicy Sri Lankan ,Indian, Malaysian and Chinese food stalls whew you can have a good meal at a price around 5$. Consuming alcohol in public places is not allowed in Sri Lanka and the same rule applies here. There is no special restrictions or risks in this are  and  there are many Police officers and Guards in this are till mid night. Normally you can visit this place from morning to night x 365 days (Except for very few days where there are some special celebrations happens here  - Ex. National Independence day) .
